00042 /**
00043  * @file
00044  *
00045  * "cvmx-usbd.h" defines a set of low level USB functions to help developers
00046  * create Octeon USB devices for various operating systems. These functions
00047  * provide a generic API to the Octeon USB blocks, hiding the internal hardware
00048  * specific operations.
00049  *
00050  * <hr>$Revision: 32636 $<hr>
00051  */
00052 
00053 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00054 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00055 extern "C" {
00056 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 typedef enum {
00060     CVMX_USBD_TRANSFER_CONTROL = 0,
00061     CVMX_USBD_TRANSFER_ISOCHRONOUS = 1,
00062     CVMX_USBD_TRANSFER_BULK = 2,
00063     CVMX_USBD_TRANSFER_INTERRUPT = 3,
00064 } cvmx_usbd_transfer_t;
00065 
00066 typedef enum {
00067     CVMX_USBD_SPEED_HIGH = 0,
00068     CVMX_USBD_SPEED_FULL = 1,
00069     CVMX_USBD_SPEED_LOW = 2,
00070 } cvmx_usbd_speed_t;
00071 
00072 typedef enum {
00073     CVMX_USBD_CALLBACK_SUSPEND,
00074     CVMX_USBD_CALLBACK_RESET,
00075     CVMX_USBD_CALLBACK_ENUM_COMPLETE,
00076     CVMX_USBD_CALLBACK_DEVICE_SETUP,
00077     CVMX_USBD_CALLBACK_IN_COMPLETE,
00078     CVMX_USBD_CALLBACK_OUT_COMPLETE,
00079     __CVMX_USBD_CALLBACK_END
00080 } cvmx_usbd_callback_t;
00081 
00082 typedef enum {
00083     CVMX_USBD_INITIALIZE_FLAGS_CLOCK_XO_XI = 1 << 0,
00084                              /**< The USB port uses a 12MHz crystal as clock source
00085                                                             at USB_XO and USB_XI. */
00086     CVMX_USBD_INITIALIZE_FLAGS_CLOCK_XO_GND = 1 << 1,
00087                              /**< The USB port uses 12/24/48MHz 2.5V board clock
00088                                                             source at USB_XO. USB_XI should be tied to GND.*/
00089     CVMX_USBD_INITIALIZE_FLAGS_CLOCK_AUTO = 0,
00090                              /**< Automatically determine clock type based on function
00091                                                              in cvmx-helper-board.c. */
00092     CVMX_USBD_INITIALIZE_FLAGS_CLOCK_MHZ_MASK = 3 << 3,
00093                                  /**< Mask for clock speed field */
00094     CVMX_USBD_INITIALIZE_FLAGS_CLOCK_12MHZ = 1 << 3,
00095                              /**< Speed of reference clock or crystal */
00096     CVMX_USBD_INITIALIZE_FLAGS_CLOCK_24MHZ = 2 << 3,
00097                              /**< Speed of reference clock */
00098     CVMX_USBD_INITIALIZE_FLAGS_CLOCK_48MHZ = 3 << 3,
00099                              /**< Speed of reference clock */
00100     /* Bits 3-4 used to encode the clock frequency */
00101     CVMX_USBD_INITIALIZE_FLAGS_DEBUG = 1 << 16
00102 } cvmx_usbd_initialize_flags_t;
00103 
00104 typedef void (*cvmx_usbd_callback_func_t) (cvmx_usbd_callback_t reason, int endpoint_num, int bytes_transferred, void *user_data);
00105 
00106 typedef struct {
00107     int init_flags;
00108     int index;
00109     cvmx_usbd_callback_func_t callback[__CVMX_USBD_CALLBACK_END];
00110     void *callback_data[__CVMX_USBD_CALLBACK_END];
00111     struct {
00112         int buffer_length;
00113     } endpoint[16];
00114 } cvmx_usbd_state_t;
00115 
00116 /**
00117  * Initialize a USB port for use. This must be called before any
00118  * other access to the Octeon USB port is made. The port starts
00119  * off in the disabled state.
00120  *
00121  * @param usb    Pointer to an empty cvmx_usbd_state_t structure
00122  *               that will be populated by the initialize call.
00123  *               This structure is then passed to all other USB
00124  *               functions.
00125  * @param usb_port_number
00126  *               Which Octeon USB port to initialize.
00127  * @param flags  Flags to control hardware initialization. See
00128  *               cvmx_usbd_initialize_flags_t for the flag
00129  *               definitions. Some flags are mandatory.
00130  *
00131  * @return Zero or a negative on error.
00132  */
00133 int cvmx_usbd_initialize(cvmx_usbd_state_t * usb, int usb_port_number, cvmx_usbd_initialize_flags_t flags);
00134 
00135 /**
00136  * Shutdown a USB port after a call to cvmx_usbd_initialize().
00137  *
00138  * @param usb    USB device state populated by
00139  *               cvmx_usbd_initialize().
00140  *
00141  * @return Zero or a negative on error.
00142  */
00143 int cvmx_usbd_shutdown(cvmx_usbd_state_t * usb);
00144 
00145 /**
00146  * Enable a USB port. After this call succeeds, the USB port is
00147  * online and servicing requests.
00148  *
00149  * @param usb  USB device state populated by
00150  *               cvmx_usb_initialize().
00151  *
00152  * @return Zero or negative on error.
00153  */
00154 int cvmx_usbd_enable(cvmx_usbd_state_t * usb);
00155 
00156 /**
00157  * Disable a USB port. After this call the USB port will not
00158  * generate data transfers and will not generate events.
00159  *
00160  * @param usb    USB device state populated by
00161  *               cvmx_usb_initialize().
00162  *
00163  * @return Zero or negative on error.
00164  */
00165 int cvmx_usbd_disable(cvmx_usbd_state_t * usb);
00166 
00167 /**
00168  * Register a callback function to process USB events
00169  *
00170  * @param usb       USB device state populated by
00171  *                  cvmx_usbd_initialize().
00172  * @param reason    The reason this callback should be called
00173  * @param func      Function to call
00174  * @param user_data User supplied data for the callback
00175  *
00176  * @return Zero on succes, negative on failure
00177  */
00178 int cvmx_usbd_register(cvmx_usbd_state_t * usb, cvmx_usbd_callback_t reason, cvmx_usbd_callback_func_t func, void *user_data);
00179 
00180 /**
00181  * Poll the USB block for status and call all needed callback
00182  * handlers. This function is meant to be called in the interrupt
00183  * handler for the USB controller. It can also be called
00184  * periodically in a loop for non-interrupt based operation.
00185  *
00186  * @param usb    USB device state populated by
00187  *               cvmx_usbd_initialize().
00188  *
00189  * @return Zero or negative on error.
00190  */
00191 int cvmx_usbd_poll(cvmx_usbd_state_t * usb);
00192 
00193 /**
00194  * Get the current USB address
00195  *
00196  * @param usb    USB device state populated by
00197  *               cvmx_usbd_initialize().
00198  *
00199  * @return The USB address
00200  */
00201 int cvmx_usbd_get_address(cvmx_usbd_state_t * usb);
00202 
00203 /**
00204  * Set the current USB address
00205  *
00206  * @param usb     USB device state populated by
00207  *                cvmx_usbd_initialize().
00208  * @param address Address to set
00209  */
00210 void cvmx_usbd_set_address(cvmx_usbd_state_t * usb, int address);
00211 
00212 /**
00213  * Get the current USB speed
00214  *
00215  * @param usb    USB device state populated by
00216  *               cvmx_usbd_initialize().
00217  *
00218  * @return The USB speed
00219  */
00220 cvmx_usbd_speed_t cvmx_usbd_get_speed(cvmx_usbd_state_t * usb);
00221 
00222 /**
00223  * Set the current USB speed
00224  *
00225  * @param usb    USB device state populated by
00226  *               cvmx_usbd_initialize().
00227  * @param speed  The requested speed
00228  */
00229 void cvmx_usbd_set_speed(cvmx_usbd_state_t * usb, cvmx_usbd_speed_t speed);
00230 
00231 /**
00232  * Enable an endpoint to respond to an OUT transaction
00233  *
00234  * @param usb    USB device state populated by
00235  *               cvmx_usbd_initialize().
00236  * @param endpoint_num
00237  *               Endpoint number to enable
00238  * @param transfer_type
00239  *               Transfer type for the endpoint
00240  * @param max_packet_size
00241  *               Maximum packet size for the endpoint
00242  * @param buffer Buffer to receive the data
00243  * @param buffer_length
00244  *               Length of the buffer in bytes
00245  *
00246  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00247  */
00248 int cvmx_usbd_out_endpoint_enable(cvmx_usbd_state_t * usb, int endpoint_num, cvmx_usbd_transfer_t transfer_type, int max_packet_size, uint64_t buffer, int buffer_length);
00249 
00250 /**
00251  * Disable an OUT endpoint
00252  *
00253  * @param usb    USB device state populated by
00254  *               cvmx_usbd_initialize().
00255  * @param endpoint_num
00256  *               Endpoint number to disable
00257  *
00258  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00259  */
00260 int cvmx_usbd_out_endpoint_disable(cvmx_usbd_state_t * usb, int endpoint_num);
00261 
00262 /**
00263  * Enable an endpoint to respond to an IN transaction
00264  *
00265  * @param usb    USB device state populated by
00266  *               cvmx_usbd_initialize().
00267  * @param endpoint_num
00268  *               Endpoint number to enable
00269  * @param transfer_type
00270  *               Transfer type for the endpoint
00271  * @param max_packet_size
00272  *               Maximum packet size for the endpoint
00273  * @param buffer Buffer to send
00274  * @param buffer_length
00275  *               Length of the buffer in bytes
00276  *
00277  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00278  */
00279 int cvmx_usbd_in_endpoint_enable(cvmx_usbd_state_t * usb, int endpoint_num, cvmx_usbd_transfer_t transfer_type, int max_packet_size, uint64_t buffer, int buffer_length);
00280 
00281 /**
00282  * Disable an IN endpoint
00283  *
00284  * @param usb    USB device state populated by
00285  *               cvmx_usbd_initialize().
00286  * @param endpoint_num
00287  *               Endpoint number to disable
00288  *
00289  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00290  */
00291 int cvmx_usbd_in_endpoint_disable(cvmx_usbd_state_t * usb, int endpoint_num);
